snippet: In a major victory for organized labor in Missouri, Republicans in the state legislature failed Wednesday to override the Democratic governor’s veto of a so-called right to work bill.
abstract: Missouri Republicans fail to garner enough votes to bypass veto of Democratic Gov Jay Nixon on bill that would have allowed workers who chose not to join unions to avoid paying union fees.
lead_paragraph: In a major victory for organized labor in Missouri, Republicans in the state legislature failed Wednesday to override the Democratic governor’s veto of a so-called right to work bill.

headline.main: Anti-Union Bill Fails in Missouri as G.O.P. Loses Override Vote
headline.print_headline: Anti-Union Bill Fails in Missouri as G.O.P. Loses Override Vote
